intro: Hieracium devoldii, commonly known as the Devold's hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Hieracium devoldii is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in high-altitude environments.
